page.title: 14Farming and Mining
page.content:
{Farming } Farming in the area has moved from the traditional mixed to the modern intensive arable farming, although one predominantly dairy farm remains. Many farms have disappeared, some amalgamating, others being purchased by the Coal Board.
{Mining } The emphasis moved from deep mining to open cast when water created a problem in Snibstone pit. Although the pit is closed, coal is still brought underground from Whitwick Pit. Open cast extraction is much cheaper and employs far fewer people. The coal is moved by overland conveyor to the railway line.
